text:
so today we are making a very typical
dessert from the north of Spain

leche frita which literally
translates to fried milk this is one of

the most delicious desserts ever it is
made with the most basic ingredients

it requires no special equipment or
special cooking skills and the flavors

are absolutely beautiful once again like
I always tell you guys this is what

Spanish cuisine is all about
we're simplicity meets extraordinary

so let's just dive right into this recipe
I'm gonna grab a nonstick sautee pan you

can also use any large nonstick frying
pan here and in 3 cups of milk now the

milk I'm using is 2% fat milk you can
also use whole fat milk here

add in 1 cinnamon stick and four lemon peels I'm
gonna hit this to a medium heat and get

in there and give it a quick mix very
important before you add your lemon

peels into the milk
make sure there's no white pith in there

as it gives it a bitter flavor if you do
have some white pith on your peels you
can use easily scrape it off with a butter knife

once this comes to a light boil I'm gonna turn off the
heat and I'm gonna let this sit here for about 20

minutes that way all these flavors can
infuse together while our milk is

infusing I'm gonna add in one cup of
milk into a bowl and start slowly adding

in half a cup of corn starch while you
whisk it all together

for the next step I'm gonna grab a casserole dish
the size of this one is 10 inches by 6 inches I'm

gonna add in about 1 teaspoon of
sunflower oil and brush it all around

this is just to ensure that when we add
in our milk mixture in there it doesn't
stick to the casserole dish

alright let's move back to our infused milk
it's been here for about 20 minutes

I'm gonna remove the lemon peels and the
cinnamon stick heat it with a medium to

low medium heat add in the 1 cup of milk
that's been whisked in with the

cornstarch and start whisking this all
together and at the same time I'm gonna
slowly add in half a cup of granulated sugar

once all the sugars been incorporated into the milk
I'm gonna continue to whisk this together until we

end up with a beautiful thick creamy
texture

after about 25 minutes and you end up
with this beautiful creamy texture I'm

gonna turn off the heat and that's the
exact texture you want from this cream

I'm going to transfer this into the
casserole dish once again very important

that you grease that casserole dish or
even add some parchment paper underneath

and I'm going to let this sit here at
room temperature until it cools off

once it's cooled off I'm gonna cover it with
saran wrap and add it into the fridge

between two to three hours this is
enough time for this milk mixture to harden up

after a couple hours I'm gonna
remove the milk mixture from the fridge

now to easily transfer our milk mixture
into a cutting board I'm gonna place a

cutting board over the casserole dish
and invert it and I'm going to cut this

thickened up milk mixture into squares
that are about one and a half inches by
one and a half inches

once we have all the squares cut up I'm
going to add in half a cup of corn

starch into a bowl two eggs into a
separate bowl and beat them together

to coat each square of the milk mixture
I'm gonna first dusted off in the cornstarch

and then into the egg wash
and as you finish each one transfer it
into a dish with some parchment paper

and continue to do this into all your
squares of milk are coated

and you want to make sure to be very gentle here
these milk squares are very fragile and
they easily break apart
alright for the final step let's fry up our squares of

milk I'm gonna grab a small fry pan
heat it with a medium heat and add in

half a cup of sunflower oil after
heating the oil between three to four

minutes and it's nice and hot I'm gonna
start adding the coated squares of milk

into the pan you want to cook these in
batches to not overcrowd the pan

after about 45 seconds to 1 minute I'm gonna
start flipping them you want them to
have a beautiful light golden color

and after a total cooking time of one
and a half to two minutes I'm going to

start removing them from the pan and
transferring them into a dish with some paper towels

and continue to fry up all your squares of milk
until they're all done

once all the squares of milk have been fried up
I'm gonna coat each square in this

sugar and cinnamon mix this is a quarter
cup of granulated sugar mixed in with
half a teaspoon of cinnamon powder

and check it out our Spanish leche frita is done
look how beautiful this turned out

let's give it a try and see how it
turned out
this leche frita looks insane here we go
it's so good you're kind of just like

It´s so good I want to eat them all
you got that crusty exterior

and then the inside just kinda melts
in your mouth as for the flavors

that lemon and that cinnamon really shine
through this is probably one of the best

desserts that hail from Spain you guys
saw it such simple ingredients so easy

to put together
the best part about this is when you

make that milk dough you can leave it in
the fridge for up to seven days to just

cut up pieces and fry them as you want you
can have dessert of this stuff almost all week long

guys super easy to make
absolutely beautiful flavors

really quick before I go a quick shout-out to
one of my patreons Terri K Kleen again

Terri thank you so much for all your
support

I truly appreciate you for the rest of
you if you're not with me on patreon

consider becoming one it helps with
ingredients and equipment to continue

making videos like this you'll find my
patreon link in the description box below
and iCard above

if you enjoyed today´s video hit that like button
leave me a comment below

and if you´re not subscribed
smash that subscribe button
until the next time...Hasta Luego!!!
